Html:
Hi,

I noticed in this post: http://blogs.southworks.net/jdominguez/2008/08/icommand-for-silverlight-with-attached-behaviors/

That an ICommand was going to be released with a drop. I have this example: http://www.jphamilton.net/post/Building-an-Enterprise-Composite-Silverlight-Application.aspx
which utilizes an assembly called AGComposite.Wpf which has ICommand inside of it. I know things have been renamed and moved around in each drop but I cannot for the life of me find the ICommand interface and the DelegateComamnds, etc.

Where did they go? Have they been replaced with something else? Please advise.

Thanks

I think I just answered my own question:


"Hi

 

The team that is developing Prism V2 is planning to add this feature in a future drop. However, the feature does not have a target date for its release.

You should keep an eye on the Prism V2 release page to check when Commanding is included.

 

Please let me know if this helps.

 

Damian Schenkelman

http://blogs.southworks.net/dschenkelman"

Source: http://www.codeplex.com/CompositeWPF/Thread/View.aspx?ThreadId=39050

My example uses the "AGCompositeLibrary" that is from a spike in changeset 14905. Just go to the source code page. It's the latest one there I think.

J.P. Hamilton
